metadata.title: CVE-2018-10924 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
It was discovered that fsync(2) system call in glusterfs client code leaksmemory. An authenticated attacker could use this flaw to launch a denial ofservice attack by making gluster clients consume memory of the hostmachine.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10924` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-client - 3.13.2-1ubuntu1+esm1
glusterfs-common - 3.13.2-1ubuntu1+esm1
glusterfs-server - 3.13.2-1ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.2-1ubuntu1+esm1').
